alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 25 at 3:04PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S affecting Scott and Clinton Counties. .Very heavy rainfall of 3 to 5 inches fell overnight upstream of De Witt in eastern Iowa. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S. * WHEN...From Sunday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Overbank flooding occurs. Water affects residences along the river between Wheatland and Calamus. Water affects businesses along the river near Calamus. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to 11.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon to 10.8 feet early Tuesday morning. It will rise above flood stage again early Tuesday afternoon to 12.2 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
